document.title: Health Education Content Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FA832A10DFE3013193C068A86D17958E.description: Promote respect for and dignity of persons living with HIV or AIDS.

FA82CC80DFE3013193BF68A86D17958E.description: Support and encourage safe, respectful, and responsible relationships.

FA1EB570DFE3013193BE68A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

FA1E5EC0DFE3013193BD68A86D17958E.description: Describe personal actions that can protect reproductive and sexual health.

FA1DDE00DFE3013193BC68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to anticipate and minimize exposure to situations that pose a risk to sexual health.

FA1D63D0DFE3013193BB68A86D17958E.description: Describe strategies for refusing unwanted sexual activity.

FA1D10E0DFE3013193BA68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

FA1CC250DFE3013193B968A86D17958E.description: Describe how HIV, AIDS, other STDs, or pregnancy could impact life goals.

FA1C7400DFE3013193B868A86D17958E.description: Develop a plan to avoid HIV, AIDS, other STDs, and pregnancy.

FA1C22C0DFE3013193B768A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

FA1BCFC0DFE3013193B668A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to evaluate the value of using FDA-approved condoms for pregnancy and STD prevention.

FA1B7A50DFE3013193B568A86D17958E.description: Explain the immediate physical, social, and emotional risks and consequences associated with sexual activity.

FA1B28A0DFE3013193B468A86D17958E.description: Identify how good health practices in adolescence affect lifelong health and the health of future children.

FA1AD9F0DFE3013193B368A86D17958E.description: Analyze the responsibilities and privileges of becoming a young adult.

FA1A80F0DFE3013193B268A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to evaluate individual differences in growth and development, physical appearance, gender roles, and sexual orientation.

FA1A2420DFE3013193B168A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to examine the characteristics of healthy relationships.

FA19AA90DFE3013193B068A86D17958E.description: Analyze why abstinence is the most effective method for the prevention of HIV, STDs, and pregnancy.

FA195600DFE3013193AF68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

FA18F5C0DFE3013193AE68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how to ask for help from parents, other trusted adults, or friends when pressured to participate in sexual behavior.

FA189BD0DFE3013193AD68A86D17958E.description: Analyze the benefits of respecting individual differences in growth and development, physical appearance, gender roles, and sexual orientation.

FA181C80DFE3013193AC68A86D17958E.description: Use healthy and respectful ways to express friendship, attraction, and affection.

FA17AC60DFE3013193AB68A86D17958E.description: Use effective verbal and nonverbal communication skills to prevent sexual involvement, HIV, other STDs, and unintended pregnancy.

FA1752D0DFE3013193AA68A86D17958E.description: Practice effective communication skills with parents, guardians, health care providers, or other trusted adults by discussing issues related to reproductive and sexual health.

FA16F850DFE3013193A968A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

FA169420DFE3013193A868A86D17958E.description: Identify health care providers for reproductive and sexual health services.

FA161EE0DFE3013193A768A86D17958E.description: Locate medically and scientifically accurate sources of information on reproductive health.

FA15B430DFE3013193A668A86D17958E.description: Identify trusted adults in one's family, school, and community for advice and counseling regarding reproductive and sexual health.

FA1548F0DFE3013193A568A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FA14EA00DFE3013193A468A86D17958E.description: Explain how sexual exploitation can occur through the Internet.

FA148F20DFE3013193A368A86D17958E.description: Recognize that there are individual, family, and cultural differences in relationships.

FA143920DFE3013193A268A86D17958E.description: Describe situations that could lead to pressure for sexual activity and to the risk of contracting HIV and other STDs.

FA13DD60DFE3013193A168A86D17958E.description: Analyze the influence of alcohol and other drugs on sexual behaviors.

FA138CB0DFE3013193A068A86D17958E.description: Evaluate how culture, media, and other people influence our perceptions of body image, gender roles, sexuality, attractiveness, relationships, and sexual orientation.

FA133D10DFE30131939F68A86D17958E.description: Analyze how internal and external influences affect growth and development, relationships, and sexual behavior.

FA12E210DFE30131939E68A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FA126590DFE30131939D68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the benefits to mother, father, and child when teenagers wait until adulthood to become parents.

FA11EC10DFE30131939C68A86D17958E.description: Describe responsible prenatal and child care, including California's Safely Surrendered Baby Law.

FA119CF0DFE30131939B68A86D17958E.description: Explain why rape and sexual assault should be reported to authorities and trusted adults.

FA114E10DFE30131939A68A86D17958E.description: Describe the emotional, psychological, and physical consequences of rape and sexual assault.

FA10FDA0DFE30131939968A86D17958E.description: Explain why individuals have the right to refuse sexual contact.

FA10AA00DFE30131939868A86D17958E.description: Recognize that there are individual differences in growth and development, physical appearance, gender roles, and sexual orientation.

FA1048B0DFE30131939768A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to prevent or reduce the risk of contracting HIV, AIDS, and other STDs.

FA0FDAC0DFE30131939668A86D17958E.description: Identify the short- and long-term effects of HIV, AIDS, and other STDs.

FA0F77C0DFE30131939568A86D17958E.description: Explain the effectiveness of FDA-approved condoms and other contraceptives in preventing HIV, other STDs, and unintended pregnancy.

FA0F2540DFE30131939468A86D17958E.description: Explain how conception occurs, the stages of pregnancy, and the responsibilities associated with parenting.

FA0ECEB0DFE30131939368A86D17958E.description: Explain the effectiveness of abstinence in preventing HIV, other STDs, and unintended pregnancy

FA0E0E70DFE30131939168A86D17958E.description: Explain physical, social, and emotional changes associated with adolescence.

FA0DB820DFE30131939068A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

FA0D0EF0DFE30131938E68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate ways to accept responsibility for conserving natural resources.

FA0CA4E0DFE30131938D68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to be a positive peer role model in the school and community.

FA0C4FC0DFE30131938C68A86D17958E.description: Promote the importance of regular screenings and medical examinations.

FA0BFCA0DFE30131938B68A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

FA0BA8B0DFE30131938A68A86D17958E.description: Describe situations where Standard (Universal) Precautions are appropriate.

FA0B54C0DFE30131938968A86D17958E.description: Practice and take responsibility for personal and dental hygiene practices.

FA0AF4D0DFE30131938868A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

FA0A7F80DFE30131938768A86D17958E.description: Create a plan to incorporate adequate rest and sleep into daily routines.

FA0A1C50DFE30131938668A86D17958E.description: Design a plan to minimize environmental pollutants, including noise at home and in the community.

FA09C020DFE30131938568A86D17958E.description: Establish goals for improving personal and community health.

FA096B90DFE30131938468A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

FA091020DFE30131938368A86D17958E.description: Analyze the characteristics of informed health choices.

FA08B1D0DFE30131938268A86D17958E.description: Apply a decision-making process when selecting health care products.

FA085BD0DFE30131938168A86D17958E.description: Apply a decision-making process to determine safe and healthy strategies for dealing with personal health problems.

FA080260DFE30131938068A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

FA07A930DFE30131937F68A86D17958E.description: Use assertive communication skills to avoid situations that increase risk of communicable disease or illness.

FA073EF0DFE30131937E68A86D17958E.description: Practice how to make a health-related consumer complaint.

FA06AEE0DFE30131937D68A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

FA065DC0DFE30131937C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how to access school and community health services.

FA060EE0DFE30131937B68A86D17958E.description: Locate resources in school, in the community, and on the Internet for first aid information and training, and assess the validity of the resources.

FA05C000DFE30131937A68A86D17958E.description: Access valid information about preventing common communicable diseases.

FA056F10DFE30131937968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to access information about personal health products (e.g., deodorant, shampoo, sunscreen, and dental care products), and evaluate the information's validity.

FA050E10DFE30131937868A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FA04B890DFE30131937768A86D17958E.description: Analyze the social influences that encourage or discourage sun-safety practices.

FA046980DFE30131937668A86D17958E.description: Analyze the influence of culture, media, and technology on health decisions.

FA0419C0DFE30131937568A86D17958E.description: Analyze the relationship between the health of a community and the global environment.

FA03C860DFE30131937468A86D17958E.description: Analyze how environmental pollutants, including noise pollution, affect health.

FA0371F0DFE30131937368A86D17958E.description: Analyze a variety of influences that affect personal health practices.

FA030840DFE30131937268A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

FA02A770DFE30131937168A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to reduce exposure to the sun.

FA023B80DFE30131937068A86D17958E.description: Describe global influences on personal and community health.

FA01DEC0DFE30131936F68A86D17958E.description: Identify human activities that contribute to environmental challenges (e.g., air, water, and noise pollution).

FA018380DFE30131936E68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways that environmental factors, including air quality, affect our health.

FA011C40DFE30131936D68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to prevent vision or hearing damage.

FA00CE00DFE30131936C68A86D17958E.description: Identify effective protection for teeth, eyes, head, and neck during sports and recreational activities.

FA007CF0DFE30131936B68A86D17958E.description: Identify effective brushing and flossing techniques for oral care.

FA002A40DFE30131936A68A86D17958E.description: Discuss the importance of effective personal and dental hygiene practices for preventing illness.

F9FFD570DFE30131936968A86D17958E.description: Examine the causes and symptoms of communicable and noncommunicable diseases.

F9FF7830DFE30131936868A86D17958E.description: Identify Standard (Universal) Precautions and why they are important.

F9FF18D0DFE30131936768A86D17958E.description: Identify the importance of age-appropriate medical services.

F9FEC890DFE30131936668A86D17958E.description: Describe the importance of health-management strategies (e.g., those involving adequate sleep, ergonomics, sun safety, hearing protection, and self-examination).

F9FE7660DFE30131936568A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F9FDBD60DFE30131936368A86D17958E.description: Object appropriately to teasing of peers and community members that is based on perceived personal characteristics or sexual orientation.

F9FD5520DFE30131936268A86D17958E.description: Promote a positive and respectful school environment.

F9FCEEA0DFE30131936168A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F9FC9F10DFE30131936068A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate skills to avoid or escape from potentially violent situations, including dating.

F9FC4C70DFE30131935F68A86D17958E.description: Practice personal boundaries in a variety of situations.

F9FBE390DFE30131935E68A86D17958E.description: Participate in clubs, organizations, and activities in the school and community that offer opportunities for student and family involvement.

F9FB74B0DFE30131935D68A86D17958E.description: Practice respect for individual differences and diverse backgrounds.

F9FB2110DFE30131935C68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate effective coping mechanisms and strategies for managing stress.

F9FAC020DFE30131935B68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F9FA6CC0DFE30131935A68A86D17958E.description: Develop achievable goals for handling stressors in healthy ways.

F9FA1100DFE30131935968A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9F9B5A0DFE30131935868A86D17958E.description: Analyze the importance of setting personal boundaries for privacy, safety, and expressions of emotions and opinions.

F9F96400DFE30131935768A86D17958E.description: Describe situations for which someone would seek help with stress, loss, an unrealistic body image, or depression.

F9F910E0DFE30131935668A86D17958E.description: Describe healthy ways to express caring, friendship, affection, and love.

F9F8AE60DFE30131935568A86D17958E.description: Monitor personal stressors and assess techniques for managing them.

F9F847E0DFE30131935468A86D17958E.description: Apply decision-making processes to a variety of situations that impact mental, emotional, and social health.

F9F7D520DFE30131935368A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F9F77E80DFE30131935268A86D17958E.description: Seek help from trusted adults for oneself or a friend with an emotional or social health problem.

F9F72D50DFE30131935168A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9F6DAB0DFE30131935068A86D17958E.description: Analyze situations to determine whether they call for acts of caring among friends or require getting the help of trusted adults.

F9F68130DFE30131934F68A86D17958E.description: Identify trusted adults to report to if people are in danger of hurting themselves or others.

F9F603E0DFE30131934E68A86D17958E.description: Describe situations for which adult help is needed, including intimidating and dangerous situations, and how to access help for oneself and others.

F9F59AF0DFE30131934D68A86D17958E.description: Access accurate sources of information and services about mental, emotional, and social health.

F9F548B0DFE30131934C68A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9F4F510DFE30131934B68A86D17958E.description: Analyze the influence of culture on family values and practices.

F9F4A180DFE30131934A68A86D17958E.description: Analyze techniques that are used to pressure someone to engage in or be a target of violent behavior.

F9F44730DFE30131934968A86D17958E.description: Analyze internal and external influences on mental, emotional, and social health.

F9F3F210DFE30131934868A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9F39240DFE30131934768A86D17958E.description: Describe common mental health conditions and why seeking professional help for these conditions is important.

F9F32C30DFE30131934668A86D17958E.description: Describe signs of depression, potential suicide, and other self-destructive behaviors.

F9F2CE40DFE30131934568A86D17958E.description: Identify the signs of various eating disorders.

F9F270F0DFE30131934468A86D17958E.description: Analyze the harmful effects of using diet pills without physician supervision.

F9F22370DFE30131934368A86D17958E.description: Describe the benefits of having positive relationships with trusted adults.

F9F1D3F0DFE30131934268A86D17958E.description: Describe the changing roles and responsibilities of adolescents as members of a family and community.

F9F184C0DFE30131934168A86D17958E.description: Recognize diversity among people, including disability, gender, race, sexual orientation, and body size.

F9F134F0DFE30131934068A86D17958E.description: Describe how emotions change during adolescence.

F9F0E0E0DFE30131933F68A86D17958E.description: Identify qualities that contribute to a positive self-image.

F9F06ED0DFE30131933E68A86D17958E.description: Identify a variety of nonviolent ways to respond when angry or upset.

F9F00910DFE30131933D68A86D17958E.description: Explain positive social behaviors (e.g., helping others, being respectful to others, cooperation, consideration).

F9EFB880DFE30131933C68A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F9EF0F60DFE30131933A68A86D17958E.description: Participate in school and community efforts to promote a drug-free lifestyle.

F9EEAF20DFE30131933968A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F9EE6290DFE30131933868A86D17958E.description: Practice positive alternatives to the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F9EE1530DFE30131933768A86D17958E.description: Use a variety of effective coping strategies when there is alcohol, tobacco, or other drug use in group situations.

F9EDC270DFE30131933668A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F9ED7100DFE30131933568A86D17958E.description: Develop short- and long-term goals to remain drug-free.

F9ED1B80DFE30131933468A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9ECBD80DFE30131933368A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to avoid using alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs in a variety of situations.

F9EC64E0DFE30131933268A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F9EC0530DFE30131933168A86D17958E.description: Use effective refusal and negotiation skills to avoid risky situations, especially where alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs are being used.

F9EBA870DFE30131933068A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9EB3860DFE30131932F68A86D17958E.description: Analyze the validity of information, products, and services related to the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F9E54240DFE30131932E68A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9E4CAD0DFE30131932D68A86D17958E.description: Analyze family and peer pressure as influences on the use of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F9E44FA0DFE30131932C68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the influence of marketing and advertising techniques and how they affect alcohol, tobacco, and other drug use and abuse.

F9E3FFD0DFE30131932B68A86D17958E.description: Analyze internal influences that affect the use and abuse of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs.

F9E3AB00DFE30131932A68A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9E350E0DFE30131932968A86D17958E.description: Explain school policies and community laws related to the use, possession, and sale of alcohol, tobacco, and illegal drugs.

F9E2CC60DFE30131932868A86D17958E.description: Explain why most youths do not use alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs.

F9E26F20DFE30131932768A86D17958E.description: Explain the short- and long-term consequences of using alcohol and other drugs to cope with problems.

F9E217A0DFE30131932668A86D17958E.description: Analyze the harmful effects of using diet pills without physician supervision.

F9E19B40DFE30131932568A86D17958E.description: Describe the consequences of using alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs during pregnancy, including fetal alcohol spectrum disorders.

F9E11CE0DFE30131932468A86D17958E.description: Explain the dangers of drug dependence and addiction.

F9E0CA60DFE30131932368A86D17958E.description: Describe the relationship between using alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs and engaging in other risky behaviors.

F9E07AC0DFE30131932268A86D17958E.description: Describe the harmful short- and long-term effects of alcohol, tobacco, and other drugs, including steroids, performance enhancing drugs and inhalants.

F9E02600DFE30131932168A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F9DF7560DFE30131931F68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to influence others' safety behaviors (e.g., wearing bicycle helmets and seat belts).

F9DF1BC0DFE30131931E68A86D17958E.description: Design a campaign for preventing violence, aggression, bullying, and harassment.

F9DEC600DFE30131931D68A86D17958E.description: Support changes to promote safety in the home, at school, and in the community.

F9DE7240DFE30131931C68A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F9DE1EE0DFE30131931B68A86D17958E.description: Practice the safe use of technology.

F9DDC1C0DFE30131931A68A86D17958E.description: Practice ways to resolve conflicts nonviolently.

F9DD6CF0DFE30131931968A86D17958E.description: Practice first aid and emergency procedures.

F9DD1CE0DFE30131931868A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F9DC7CD0DFE30131931668A86D17958E.description: Make a personal commitment to avoid persons, places, or activities that encourage violence or delinquency.

F9DC24C0DFE30131931568A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9DBC580DFE30131931468A86D17958E.description: Apply decision-making or problem-solving steps to hypothetical situations involving assault and intimidation, including sexual harassment.

F9DB7180DFE30131931368A86D17958E.description: Evaluate why some students are bullies.

F9DB1ED0DFE30131931268A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to analyze the consequences of gang involvement.

F9DACA20DFE30131931168A86D17958E.description: Apply a decision-making process to avoid potentially dangerous situations, such as gang activities, violence in dating, and other social situations.

F9DA71B0DFE30131931068A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to examine risky social and dating situations.

F9DA0910DFE30131930F68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F9D9ABE0DFE30131930E68A86D17958E.description: Locate resources in school, in the community, and on the Internet for first aid information and training, and assess the validity of the resources.

F9D93F00DFE30131930D68A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between passive, aggressive, and assertive communication.

F9D88F80DFE30131930B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate ways to ask a parent or other trusted adult for help with a threatening situation.

F9D83380DFE30131930A68A86D17958E.description: Describe ways to manage interpersonal conflicts nonviolently.

F9D7E5A0DFE30131930968A86D17958E.description: Use communication and refusal skills to avoid violence, gang involvement, and risky situations.

F9D79670DFE30131930868A86D17958E.description: Report to a trusted adult situations that could lead to injury or harm.

F9D74470DFE30131930768A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9D6F430DFE30131930668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to access accurate sources of information about abuse, violence, and bullying.

F9D69FE0DFE30131930568A86D17958E.description: Analyze sources of information regarding injury and violence prevention.

F9D638D0DFE30131930468A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9D5E090DFE30131930368A86D17958E.description: Evaluate individual, group, and societal influences that promote cooperation and respectful behaviors and those that promote violence and disrespectful behaviors.

F9D58C40DFE30131930268A86D17958E.description: Analyze how the media portray fire and explosives.

F9D52190DFE30131930168A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9D4BDC0DFE30131930068A86D17958E.description: Explain ways to reduce the risk of injuries (including oral injuries) that can occur during sports and recreational activities.

F9D45210DFE3013192FF68A86D17958E.description: Explain ways to reduce the risk of injuries in and around water.

F9D3FEF0DFE3013192FE68A86D17958E.description: Explain ways to prevent fires and reduce the risk of fire-related injuries.

F9D3AA40DFE3013192FD68A86D17958E.description: Explain safety hazards associated with Internet usage.

F9D35200DFE3013192FC68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to prevent climate-related physical conditions such as exhaustion, sunburn, heat stroke, and hypothermia.

F9D2F790DFE3013192FB68A86D17958E.description: Identify basic safety guidelines for emergencies and natural disasters.

F9D29630DFE3013192FA68A86D17958E.description: Describe the behavioral and environmental factors associated with major causes of death in the United States.

F9D23A30DFE3013192F968A86D17958E.description: Describe types of sexual harassment and ways to report them.

F9D1E600DFE3013192F868A86D17958E.description: Describe possible legal consequences of sexual harassment and violence.

F9D19280DFE3013192F768A86D17958E.description: Identify trusted adults to whom school or community violence should be reported.

F9D13DC0DFE3013192F668A86D17958E.description: Explain how violence, aggression, bullying, and harassment affect health and safety.

F9D0DD60DFE3013192F568A86D17958E.description: Discuss the importance of reporting weapon possession.

F9D08A60DFE3013192F468A86D17958E.description: Describe how the presence of weapons increases the risk of serious violent injuries.

F9D03180DFE3013192F368A86D17958E.description: Explain how witnesses and bystanders can help prevent violence by reporting dangerous situations.

F9CFCD50DFE3013192F268A86D17958E.description: Describe the differences between physical, verbal, and sexual violence.

F9CF5C30DFE3013192F168A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F9CEB420DFE3013192EF68A86D17958E.description: Encourage peers to eat healthy foods and to be physically active.

F9CE62A0DFE3013192EE68A86D17958E.description: Support increased opportunities for physical activity at school and in the community.

F9CE0820DFE3013192ED68A86D17958E.description: Encourage nutrient-dense food choices in school.

F9CD9CF0DFE3013192EC68A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F9CD4E00DFE3013192EB68A86D17958E.description: Examine ways to be physically active throughout a lifetime.

F9CCB010DFE3013192E968A86D17958E.description: Explain proper food handling safety when preparing meals and snacks.

F9CC5D20DFE3013192E868A86D17958E.description: Make healthy food choices in a variety of settings.

F9CC02C0DFE3013192E768A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F9CBA160DFE3013192E668A86D17958E.description: Set a goal to increase daily physical activity.

F9CB4BC0DFE3013192E568A86D17958E.description: Make a personal plan for improving one's nutrition and incorporating physical activity into daily routines.

F9CAEDE0DFE3013192E468A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F9CA8BB0DFE3013192E368A86D17958E.description: Analyze the physical, mental, and social benefits of physical activity.

F9CA1ED0DFE3013192E268A86D17958E.description: Contrast healthy and risky approaches to weight management.

F9C9BF00DFE3013192E168A86D17958E.description: Identify recreational activities that increase physical activity.

F9C96C30DFE3013192E068A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to evaluate daily food intake for nutritional requirements.

F9C91850DFE3013192DF68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F9C8C240DFE3013192DE68A86D17958E.description: Practice effective communication skills with parents, guardians, or trusted adults regarding healthy nutrition and physical activity choices.

F9C851E0DFE3013192DD68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to use effective skills to model healthy decision making and prevent overconsumption of foods and beverages.

F9C7D7C0DFE3013192DC68A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9C783C0DFE3013192DB68A86D17958E.description: Identify trusted adults in one's family, school, and community for advice and counseling regarding healthy eating and physical activity.

F9C72FB0DFE3013192DA68A86D17958E.description: Identify places where youths and families can be physically active.

F9C6D8F0DFE3013192D968A86D17958E.description: Describe how to access nutrition information about foods offered in restaurants in one's community.

F9C68380DFE3013192D868A86D17958E.description: Evaluate the accuracy of claims about dietary supplements and popular diets.

F9C620B0DFE3013192D768A86D17958E.description: Distinguish between valid and invalid sources of nutrition information.

F9C5BD50DFE3013192D668A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9C56020DFE3013192D568A86D17958E.description: Analyze the influence of technology and media on physical activity.

F9C4F070DFE3013192D468A86D17958E.description: Analyze the impact of nutritional choices on future reproductive and prenatal health.

F9C487B0DFE3013192D368A86D17958E.description: Evaluate internal and external influences on food choices.

F9C409F0DFE3013192D268A86D17958E.description: Describe the influence of culture and media on body image.

F9C39F40DFE3013192D168A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9C33590DFE3013192D068A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between physical activity and exercise and health-related and skill-related fitness.

F9C2DD00DFE3013192CF68A86D17958E.description: Explain that incorporating daily moderate or vigorous physical activity into one's life does not require a structured exercise plan or special equipment.

F9C26F50DFE3013192CE68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to increase daily physical activity.

F9C211C0DFE3013192CD68A86D17958E.description: Explain how to use a Body Mass Index (BMI) score as a tool for measuring general health.

F9C1C450DFE3013192CC68A86D17958E.description: Examine the role of lifelong fitness activities in maintaining personal fitness, blood pressure, weight, and percentage of body fat.

F9C17630DFE3013192CB68A86D17958E.description: Analyze the cognitive and physical benefits of eating breakfast daily.

F9C12750DFE3013192CA68A86D17958E.description: Identify the impact of nutrition on chronic disease.

F9C0D200DFE3013192C968A86D17958E.description: Analyze the harmful effects of engaging in unscientific diet practices to lose or gain weight.

F9C07F90DFE3013192C868A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to prepare food that are consistent with current research-based guidelines for a nutritionally balanced diet.

F9C02800DFE3013192C768A86D17958E.description: Describe the benefits of eating a variety of foods high in iron, calcium, and fiber.

F9BFD6D0DFE3013192C668A86D17958E.description: Analyze the caloric and nutritional value of foods and beverages.

F9BF8530DFE3013192C568A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between diets that are health-promoting and diets linked to disease.

F9BF3010DFE3013192C468A86D17958E.description: Describe how to keep food safe through proper food purchasing, preparation, and storage practices.

F9BECD50DFE3013192C368A86D17958E.description: Examine the health risks caused by food contaminants.

F9BE7B90DFE3013192C268A86D17958E.description: Identify nutrients and their relationships to health.

F9BE2100DFE3013192C168A86D17958E.description: Describe the short- and long-term impact of nutritional choices on health.

F9BDC040DFE3013192C068A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.
